lender.name: Margaret
lender.loan_because: even though I can't give a large sum, I am so pleased that over the last few years I have been able to reloan funds numerous times-- it's individual entrepreneurs who keep the world's economies truly alive and vibrant. We're lucky to have Kiva to help organize our assistance to those who want to develop their business ideas.
lender.occupational_info: I am hired by individual families to cook and store meals for them. The families I work for are either very busy, have challenging dietary restrictions or are elderly and need extra help with meals

lender.name: Joe
lender.loan_because:
It is the very least I can do. How can I or anyone else stand ideally by and not help our fellow brothers and sisters in need. I dare anyone to give. To whom much is given, much is required.
"The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little".
Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945) Thirty-second President of the USA
lender.occupational_info: I'm just a Soldier in the U.S. Army.

lender.name: Hannah

lender.name: Drew Rowell
lender.loan_because:
I firmly believe that small businesses are the key to building up an economy and helping a nation.
Instead of just putting in more resources, which only helps people for a small amount of time, microlending stimulates (and increases) the transfer of resources by allowing small businesses to grow, which insures that those business owners the ability to spend in other places in the long run, which in turn gives others the ability to spend.
It's a cycle, and I think that microlending is a great way to help the cycle get started.
lender.occupational_info:
I'm a sophomore at a high school in Missouri, USA. I enjoy programming and writing. I live on a farm so I also like taking care of and spending time with animals.
You can read my blog at http://www.linuxdistroreview.com

lender.name: Robyn
lender.loan_because:
I LOST MY MOTHER THIS 4TH OF JULY DUE TO A SUDDEN HEART ATTACK. SHE WAS A VERY LOVING AND GIVING PERSON WHO BELIVED THAT ONE HAND SHOULD ALWAYS BE OPEN IN THE ACT OF GIVEIING. INTO HER OTHER HAND SHE BELIVED MORE WOULD BE GIVEN. I THINK HER POINT WAS IF WE HOLD ON TIGHT TO WHAT WE HAVE BEEN BLESSED WITH, THE BLESSING WILL STOP. SOMETIMES THINGS ARE JUST MEANT TO PASS THROUGH US TO OTHERS. IN THE LAST YEARS OF HER LIFE SHE GAVE HER MONEY TO "TV CHURCHS" AS SHE WAS HOUSE BOUND DUE TO MY STEP- FATHER'S ILLNESS, AND CARING FOR HIM 24/7.
SHE AND I HAD TALKED ABOUT KIVA AND THE WORK IT WAS DOING "PERSON TO PERSON" AND I AM SENDING HER 10% OUT INTO THE WORLD IN HER HONOR.
I MISS HER VERY MUCH AND HOPE THAT THESE LOANS WILL HELP OTHERS MAKE THEIR WAY INTO A BETTER LIFE, TAKE CARE, ROBYN
lender.occupational_info:
I HAVE WORKED WITH ANIMALS ALL MY LIFE AND ENJOY RAISING SIAMESE KITTENS THAT BRING SUCH JOY TO THE FAMILIES THAT ADOPT THEM---YOU CAN BUY LOVE & LOYALTY!!!
IT IS NOT BRAIN SURGURY; BUT FROM THE CARDS AND LETTERS I GET FROM MY EXTENDED CAT FAMILY I KNOW THESE LOVING, LOYAL, INTELLIGENT CREATURES ARE BRINGING UNCONDITIONAL LOVE INTO THEIR NEW FAMILIES LIVES.

lender.name: Colorado
lender.occupation: real estate broker at Colorado real estate
lender.loan_because: Here are a lot of comments made on this site placing blame or trying to place blame everywhere but where it should be. Whatever happened to accountability? Is it not our responsibility as consumers to read what we sign? Is it not our responsibility to educate ourselves before we commit to a transaction, no matter what the transaction may be? Yes, there are a lot of Colorado real estate Mortgage Lenders out there that are unscrupulous. I find that fact not only distasteful but disturbing as well. On the other hand there are a lot of real estate Mortgage Lenders out there that are not unscrupulous. I believe in education, the problem is that you are not taught in high school or college what a summit county real estate http://www.luckymountainhome.com/summit_county_real_estate/ mortgage loan is, how the interest rates work or what is the best avenue for you to take when you complete a mortgage transaction. For example: A person has a daughter in College so the parents want to purchase a house close to the University for the daughter to live in. The daughter will be attending the college for 4 years. After 4 years the parents plan to sell the house. Does it make more sense for the parents to take out a 30 year fixed rate mortgage? Or could it make more sense for them to take out a 5 year ARM? It would all depend right? You would need to weigh the facts. What is the rate? What are the costs involved? After 5 years will they be ready to sell? Of course, you have to consider everything. But, what you DIDN'T know, was what will happen to this family within the next 5 years. Ideally, everything breckenridge foreclosures http://www.luckymountainhome.com/service/for_buyers/foreclosures/ that happens is great. Dad gets a great promotion and his income increases. Mom won the lottery and now has an extra $100,000.00 to put in the bank for retirement. But the reality of it is that sometimes bad things happen. Dad lost his job and Mom was diagnosed with . All of a sudden it really doesn't matter what kind of a summit county real estate mortgage loan they have.....they simply can not pay it. I think it's high time Americans hold themselves accountable for what they do. Stop blaming everyone but yourself. Instead, educate yourself. Learn how the interest rates work, learn about the different types of mortgages available and do the math! It's basic simple math! We've been told by Financial Planners for years that a 30 year fixed rate is the "smartest" loan you can get, therefore that's the loan you should get. But is that entirely true? Perhaps it is true for some individuals, but not for others. It all depends on your individual situation.

lender.name: Brian B.
lender.occupation: Policy Advisor Ministry of Economic Affairs
lender.loan_because: I believe that helping people do business is the only way to effectively empower people and help their economy, society and community grow.
lender.occupational_info: As a policy advisor ''Better Regulation' for the Ministry of Economic Affairs in the Netherlands I know how inportant it is for an entrepreneur to just be able to DO business. Getting credit is one of the impediments entrepreneurs have to deal with.

lender.name: Greg
lender.loan_because: God shows grace & mercy to me because He sent us His son Jesus to provide an example of how we should live and invest our time on earth. Jesus once said, recorded in Matthew 5:42, "Give to the one who comes with a request, and do not keep that which was given to you from him who would for a time make use of it."
lender.occupational_info: I work to assist other people with the process of creating and manufacturing medicines, medical devices and products to heal and ease the suffering of those who need it most. I volunteer my time to Heartbeat For Africa and facilitate Microenterprise Development Training.

lender.name: Alexa
lender.loan_because: I think it is a great way to help people who work hard!
lender.occupational_info: I work with youth from grades 5 - 12 in an Alliance church.

lender.name: DANIEL & HOLLY
lender.loan_because: Helping someone in need, person to person is the right thing to do.

lender.name: Ken
lender.loan_because: I see how a little can make a huge difference.
lender.occupational_info: I am a Performance & Learning Consultant with a large credit union.

lender.name: Halsted
lender.loan_because: I want to help people succeed.
lender.occupational_info: I do stuff with words.

lender.name: Zdenko

lender.occupational_info: IT, software development

lender.name: Claire
